p: A doseâ€“response effect was observed in the insecticidal activity of the three EOs in both An. stephensi and An. gambiae. In An. stephensi, mortality caused by hemp EO at 100 ppm was 82.7% and 100% (Felina 32), 90.2% and 94.2% (CS female), and 89.8% and 90.5% (CS male) on larvae and pupae, respectively. At the same concentration (100 ppm), the mortality produced on An. gambiae was 91.1% and 84.9% (Felina 32), 91.6% and 79.6% (CS female), and 89.8% and 79.7% (CS male) on larvae and pupae, respectively. Mortality of 100% was observed when the mosquitoes (L3 and pupae) were exposed at the maximus dilution of the three EOs.
